title: Hezbollah rocket barrage hammers homes in Golan Heights
message:
Terrorist organization Hezbollah rained rockets down on Israeli territory this week as cease-fire negotiations between Hamas and Israel continue to deteriorate.
"Hezbollah continues to indiscriminately fire projectiles toward Israel," the Israel Defense Forces said in a statement Wednesday.
Israel maintains the Golan Heights is necessary for national security and the territory was officially annexed in 1967.
Israel and Hezbollah have consistently exchanged missile strikes since October of last year, when the Hamas-led terrorist attack on the Jewish state initiated the ongoing conflict.
Hamas and Israel have been unable to finalize a cease-fire deal, despite extensive assistance from United States diplomats.

title: Gaza rescuers say Israeli strike on school shelter kills three
message:
Agency spokesman Mahmud Bassal told AFP that 10 of the injured were children.
A father told AFP his child was killed in the strike while playing in the schoolyard.
He had no missile, no plane, no tank.”Witness Omar Abu Charar told AFP that he went to the scene after hearing “an enormous explosion” and seeing smoke.
On Tuesday, Bassal told AFP that a strike on the Mustafa Hafiz school in Gaza City killed at least 12 people.
The Israeli military said that school, too, was a Hamas command centre.

title: Greek oil tanker drifting and ablaze after repeated attacks in the Red Sea , British military says
message:
A Greek-flagged oil tanker traveling through the Red Sea has come under repeated attack, leaving the vessel “not under command” and drifting ablaze in an assault suspected to have been carried out by Yemen’s Houthi rebelsGreek oil tanker drifting and ablaze after repeated attacks in the Red Sea, British military saysDUBAI, United Arab Emirates -- A Greek-flagged oil tanker traveling through the Red Sea came under repeated attack Wednesday, leaving the vessel “not under command” and drifting ablaze after an assault suspected to have been carried out by Yemen's Houthi rebels, the British military said.
“No casualties reported.”Later, the UKMTO warned that the ship was drifting while on fire in the Red Sea.
Other missiles and drones have either been intercepted by a U.S.-led coalition in the Red Sea or failed to reach their targets.
A Liberian-flagged oil tanker came under a particularly intense series of attacks beginning Aug. 8, likely carried out by the rebels.
The last three recent attacks, including Wednesday's, targeted vessels associated with Delta Tankers, a Greek company.

message:
A Greek-flagged oil tanker travelling through the Red Sea came under repeated attack Wednesday, leaving the vessel “not under command” and drifting ablaze after an assault suspected to have been carried out by Yemen’s Houthi rebels, the British military said.
“No casualties reported.”Later, the UKMTO warned that the ship was drifting while on fire in the Red Sea.
That ship, the Wind I, came under attack again Thursday with two more explosions striking in the water, the UKMTO said.

Avichay Adraee, spokesperson for the Israeli army, confirmed the attack in a statement, saying that "a Hamas military compound in the Salah al-Din school in Gaza City was targeted."

message:

“No casualties reported.”Later, the UKMTO warned that the ship was drifting while on fire in the Red Sea.
That ship, the Wind I, came under attack again Thursday with two more explosions striking in the water, the UKMTO said.

title: Australia , Kongsberg to Build Long - Range Missiles in Newcastle
message:
(Bloomberg) -- Australia will invest up to A$850 million ($573 million) in partnership with Kongsberg Gruppen ASA to manufacture long-range missiles in the city of Newcastle, north of Sydney.
Most Read from BloombergThe new plant will build and service Naval Strike Missiles and Joint Strike Missiles for the Australian military, Pat Conroy, minister for defense industry, said in a statement on Thursday.
The Joint Strike Missile — which can be fitted to the F-35A aircraft — and Naval Strike Missiles are modern anti-ship cruise missiles designed to attack enemy warships.
Construction of the missile factory is due to start later this year in the Newcastle Airport precinct and once complete is expected to employ about 100 people, according to the government.
Most Read from Bloomberg Businessweek©2024 Bloomberg L.P.

title: Hezbollah rockets hit Golan after Israel strikes deep in Lebanon
message:
Hezbollah has launched dozens of rockets at the occupied Golan Heights after Israeli aircraft struck deep inside Lebanon, as fears of an all-out war grow.
The Israeli military said it hit Hezbollah weapons storage facilities in the Bekaa Valley overnight.
In response, Hezbollah, which is backed by Iran, said it targeted Israeli military positions in the Golan with a rocket barrage.
Israeli authorities said two homes were hit and one person was injured.
Meanwhile, the Palestinian Fatah movement accused Israel of assassinating a senior member of its armed wing in Lebanon in an effort to ignite a regional conflict.

title: Second Navy aircraft carrier arrives in Mideast amid regional conflict fears
message:
A second Navy aircraft carrier, the USS Abraham Lincoln, arrived in the Middle East on Wednesday escorted by guided missile destroyers, the U.S. Central Command said.
The carrier, equipped with F-35 fighter jets, added to the U.S. ships already in the region, including the USS Theodore Roosevelt aircraft carrier, which arrived in mid-July.
In addition to the Lincoln, Austin ordered the USS Georgia, a guided missile submarine, to the Middle East in a rare acknowledgment of U.S. submarine whereabouts.
During Iran's retaliatory attack on Israel for a strike on an Iranian consulate in April, Navy destroyers like the USS Carney helped shoot down some of the incoming missiles.
The Pentagon said the U.S. is sending additional forces to support Israel if there is an attack and to be prepared for any escalation.

title: Israeli Assassinations Are Near - Daily In Lebanon , Airstrikes Reaching Deeper
message:
The past several days have seen a significant uptick in rare Israeli airstrikes deep into Lebanese territory, with multiple airstrikes having hit the Bekaa Valley in the country's east.
These strikes occurred more than 40 miles from the Israeli border, and Israeli typically launches such rare long-range operations in response to deadly Hezbollah rocket attacks.
As for the latest IDF attacks on Bekaa, Lebanon’s health ministry said in the aftermath that eight people total, including two Syrian children, were wounded.
"Hezbollah said the attack was in response to an Israeli strike deep into Lebanon on Tuesday night that killed one and injured 19," AP reports.
"On Tuesday, Hezbollah launched more than 200 projectiles toward Israel, after Israel targeted a Hezbollah weapons depot some 80 kilometers (50 miles) from the border, a significant increase in the daily skirmishes."

title: Taylor Swift Addresses Cancellation of Vienna Shows Due to Terror Plot
message:
Taylor Swift is speaking out after three Eras Tour Vienna shows were canceled due to an alleged terror plot.
“Taylor Swift’s The Eras Tour Vienna shows [have been] canceled due to government officials’ confirmation of planned terrorist attack,” the statement read.
Related: Celebrities Who Had the Time of Their Lives at Taylor Swift's 'Eras Tour' Several of Taylor Swift’s famous friends and fans have shown up to shake it off at the singer’s much-anticipated The Eras Tour.
[…]“I love a rain show but I’m never going to endanger my fans or my fellow performers and crew,” Swift wrote via X at the time.
The decision came days after a 23-year-old woman named Ana Clara Benevides Machado died from heat exhaustion after seeking medical care at another Eras Tour performance in the Brazilian city.

message:
Officials in Arapahoe County, Colorado, were called to investigate a piece of history that was found by a group of on-site construction workers.
While on the scene, Aurora Police requested Arapahoe Sheriff’s Department Bomb Squad to determine a metal device that was found.
The former Lowry Bombing and Gunnery Range has four former Titan I missile complexes that were operational from 1962 to 1965.

title: Biden presses Netanyahu for Gaza truce and hostage release
message:
US President Joe Biden has urged Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu to reach an agreement for a truce in Gaza and secure the release of hostages, according to the White House.
Biden, joined by Vice President Kamala Harris, emphasised the importance of finalising the ceasefire and hostage deal during the conversation.
In the latest developments, Israeli military jets targeted approximately 30 sites across Gaza, including tunnels, launch sites, and observation posts.
The Israeli military accused Hamas of using civilian structures as shields, an allegation the militant group has repeatedly denied.
According to Palestinian health authorities, more than 40,000 people have been killed in Gaza since the start of the Israeli military campaign in October.

title: Israel kills top Palestinian Fatah commander as Gaza truce talks stumble
message:
Israel kills top Palestinian Fatah's commander as Gaza truce talks stumbleWorld World Israel kills top Palestinian Fatah's commander as Gaza truce talks stumbleFatah said Khalil Maqdah died in an attack near the southern Lebanese city of Sidon.
Blinken appealed to Hamas to urgently accept a US-backed truce proposal, while also publicly disagreeing with Israel over its future presence in the besieged Palestinian territory.
CALL FOR FLEXIBILITYSince the war began, it was made "very clear that the United States does not accept any long-term occupation of Gaza by Israel", Blinken said when asked about Netanyahu's remarks.
But he added that Israel had already agreed on the "schedule and location" of troop withdrawals from Gaza in the talks.
Gaza's civil defence agency said two people were killed and 10 children injured in an Israeli strike on a school-turned-shelter.

title: Israel kills top Fatah commander
message:
Fatah, which is headed by Palestinian president Mahmud Abbas and rivals the Gaza Strip's Hamas, responded by accusing Israel of seeking to trigger a wider war.
Maqdah's killing marks the first such attack on a senior Fatah member in more than 10 months of cross-border clashes between Israel and Lebanon's Hezbollah movement during the Gaza war.
"Time is of the essence," Blinken said before flying out of Doha after stops in Egypt and Israel.
Netanyahu insisted Israel maintain control of the Philadelphi Corridor, the border between Gaza and Egypt that Israeli forces seized from Hamas, which Israel says relies on secret tunnels to bring in weapons.
Hamas said it was "keen to reach a ceasefire" but protested "new conditions" from Israel in the latest US proposal.

title: Israel - Hamas war day 320 : What happening in Israel , Gaza ?
message:
Israel Air Force jets practicing aerial refuelling as part of readiness preparations, August 15, 2024.
“The Air Force is our iron fist that knows how to hit the soft underbelly of our enemies,” Netanyahu said as he visited the Ramat David Air Force base in the North.
Israel Air Force (IAF) pilots and crew who took part in the strike on Yemen during Operation Outstretched Arm.
Netanyahu said “I am here, at the air force base, to closely monitor our preparations against threats both near and far.
The stakes have been raised since Israel killed senior Hezbollah commander Fuad Shukr at the end of last month.

title: Australia to manufacture Kongsberg cruise missiles
message:
SYDNEY (Reuters) - Australia said it will jointly manufacture long-range Naval Strike Missiles and Joint Strike Missiles with Norway's Kongsberg Defence in the city of Newcastle on Australia's eastern coast, the only site outside of Norway.
Defence Industry Minister Pat Conroy said the Australian government will contribute A$850 million ($573.8 million) to establish a manufacturing facility with Kongsberg at the Newcastle Airport precinct later this year.
The anti-ship cruise missiles would be used by the Australian Defence Force, he said in a statement, and will be one of only two facilities in the world capable of producing the missiles, and the only site outside Kongsberg, Norway.
Australia has said it will establish guided weapons manufacturing under a defence overhaul to boost the Australian Defence Force's long-range precision strike ability, amid rising tensions in the Indo-Pacific.
($1 = 1.4815 Australian dollars)(Reporting by Kirsty Needham in Sydney; Editing by Stephen Coates)

title: Missile Defenses : Robust Testing Program Essential
message:
Even “failed” tests, if properly constructed, contribute to the understanding and advance of ballistic missile technology.
Split-Second Precision an ImperativeThe highly sophisticated nature of ballistic missile defenses makes testing an imperative.
Radars provide timely information about that environment, and the command-and-control system enables execution of the ballistic missile defense mission.
Robust Testing Program EssentialOpponents of missile defense argue that the missile defense system is unproven.
Rather, it should strive to strike a balance between advancing the technology and validating its missile defense system.

title: Biden continues to advocate for Israel - Hamas cease - fire in call with Netanyahu
message:
President Joe Biden spoke with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu on Wednesday, discussing the ongoing defense of Israel against Iran and proxies like Hezbollah.
Israeli tank and drone strikes in Gaza on Wednesday killed at least 17 people, according to hospital staff and Associated Press journalists who counted the bodies.
Lebanon’s Hezbollah on Wednesday launched more than 50 rockets, hitting a number of private homes in the Israel-annexed Golan Heights.
Hezbollah said the attack was in response to an Israeli strike deep into Lebanon on Tuesday night.
Hamas is believed to still be holding around 110 hostages captured during the Oct. 7 attacks that started the war.

title: Bulletproof Trump In NC : First Outdoor Rally Since Assassination Attempt | NewsRadio 740 KTRH
message:
Another day, and another DNC convention counter-rally for former president Donald Trump, who held his first outdoor rally since the assassination attempt, with a stop in Asheboro, North Carolina.
With thousands in attendance, Trump was surrounded by a wall of bulletproof glass while he spoke at the podium.
There was also a moment when Trump left the stage because someone in the crowd was having a medical emergency.
Trump, along with VP candidate, Sen. JD Vance hit on national security, while highlighting the Biden-Harris’ record on Ukraine and the botched withdrawal from Afghanistan.
And probably the highlight was when Trump told the crowd he has finally decided on a nickname for Kamala Harris.

title: Trump holds first outdoor rally since attempted assassination
message:
It was his first big outdoor event since being lightly wounded in an attempted assassination at a similarly open site in Butler, Pennsylvania, a month ago.
That attack left one rally participant dead before the 20-year-old gunman was killed by a Secret Service sniper.
The Secret Service recommended that Trump stick to more easily controllable indoor venues such as sports arenas.
The Secret Service does not comment publicly on security operations and did not respond to requests for comment on Wednesday's preparations.
At one point during his speech, Trump left the stage and entered the crowd to check on an attendee who was suffering a medical issue.

title: Friendly fire deaths in Gaza speak volumes about the chaos of war
message:
This week, he became the latest Israeli victim of the Gaza war.
It highlights, however, the rarely considered phenomenon of friendly fire deaths in Gaza, which reveal much about the nature of the war.
Ben Nun’s death brought the tally of Israeli deaths that resulted from friendly fire or accident to 53, out of a total casualty count of 330.
Much was made of the announcement by Hamas last week that 40,000 Palestinians had lost their lives in the war.
(Indeed, it recently emerged that Hamas had planned to disinter the remains of British servicemen from their World War One grave in central Gaza and hold the bodies hostage for ransom from London.)

title: London stabbing victim Laila Johnson speaks out
message:
A brave 11-year-old Australian girl has spoken about her terrifying ordeal after she was grabbed in a headlock and stabbed eight times in London’s busy Leicester Square.
Laila Johnson was on a trip with her mother, Samantha, exploring London after travelling to see the Matildas play in the Olympic Games in Paris, when the pair were allegedly confronted by homeless man Ioan Pintaru.
Laila Johnson survived a stabbing attack in London.
Credit: FacebookPintaru allegedly attacked Laila with a steak knife as her mother tried to shield her daughter.
I couldn’t sleep,” Laila told Ben Fordham on 2GB.

message:

title: Iran signals promised strike on Israel may not be imminent
message:
Even Iran’s Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps, the country’s most powerful security force, said that an attack might not come right away.
Immediately after Haniyeh’s assassination, which came just hours after Israel killed a senior Hezbollah commander near Beirut, the region went on high alert.
In April, Iran retaliated against Israel for a deadly strike on the Iranian Embassy complex in Damascus, which killed seven people, including senior military advisers.
Iran’s mission to the United Nations also hinted that the response may take a different form.
“The timing, conditions, and manner of Iran’s response will be meticulously orchestrated to ensure that it occurs at a moment of maximum surprise,” the statement said.

title: Trump speaks from behind bulletproof glass at 1st outdoor rally since Butler shooting
message:
Trump speaks from behind bulletproof glass at 1st outdoor rally since Butler shootingDonald Trump spoke behind bulletproof glass at his rally in North Carolina on Wednesday as new security measures are being put in place after the assassination attempt against the former president.
Trump was surrounded by the barriers as he addressed supporters in Asheboro.
The event marked his first outdoor rally since the shooting on July 13 in Butler, Pennsylvania, during which Trump and two others were injured and one person was killed.
At one point, Trump momentarily stepped out of the glass and walked off stage to check on someone in the crowd who he said may be struggling with the heat.
The use of ballistic glass is typically only used for sitting presidents.

title: Police charge three men over alleged roles in  muscle gang
message:
Police today charged three men for their alleged roles as a "freelance gang" that was being hired to carry out shootings, home invasions and kidnappings across southwest Sydney.
Two 20-year-old men from Fairfield West and Mt Druitt and an 18-year-old man from Lakemba were arrested during raids of homes early yesterday.
READ MORE: Aussie girl stabbed in London attack refused to miss Taylor SwiftPolice have charged three men in Sydney for their alleged roles as a crime gang for hire.
Police will allege the Fairfield West man led the gang and accepted tasks from organised crime networks.
"The dismantling of this group is a major blow to organised crime in this state and a relief for the people of south west Sydney," he said.

title: Bronze Age Warfare : Insights From Archaeological , Textual Evidence
message:
"By considering the most frequently attested weapons employed in siege warfare it is possible to assess the function and effectiveness of these weapons.
Typical weapons for the Middle Bronze age are a dagger, battle-axe, spear or javelin.
"The Kirta Epic illustrates a number of details regarding siege warfare: 'Like grasshoppers, you will invade the field, like locusts the edges of the steppe-land.
"From this passage several observations regarding Bronze Age warfare can be made.
Finally, it also provides a glimpse into the real discomforts that siege warfare inflicted on a population [and their animals]," Burke elaborated.

title: Irish man fighting in Ukraine reported missing , presumed dead
message:
Irish man fighting in Ukraine reported missing, presumed deadUkrainian soldiers raising the country's flag.
Picture: GettyBy Henry MooreAn Irish man fighting for Ukraine has been reported missing, presumed dead.
According to reports, Ryzhuk had been serving as a volunteer in Eastern Ukraine when he was reported missing.
If confirmed dead, he would become the fourth Irish citizen to die fighting in Ukraine.
"This was one of the biggest attempts of all time to attack Moscow using drones," Moscow mayor Sergey Sobyanin said on his Telegram channel.

title: Russo - Ukraine War - 21 August 2024
message:
On 24 February 2022, Ukraine was suddenly and deliberately attacked by land, naval and air forces of Russia, igniting the largest European war since the Great Patriotic War.
"To initiate a war of aggression... is not only an international crime; it is the supreme international crime differing only from other war crimes in that it contains within itself the accumulated evil of the whole."
More than three thousand shellings were also carried out at the positions of Ukrainian troops and settlements.
In the Toretsky direction Russians five times attacked Ukrainian troops near Toretsk and Northern.
Four counter-attacks of the AFU 72nd Mechanised Brigade and the 125th Territorial Defence Brigade have been repelled.

title: The Future of India Air Superiority : Beyond the Super - Sukhoi and Towards 5th - 6th Generation Jets – Indian Defence Research Wing
message:
The Future of India’s Air Superiority: Beyond the Super-Sukhoi and Towards 5th-6th Generation Jets| BySOURCE: AFIAs technology in the aerospace domain advances, India faces the inevitable need to replace its fleet of Su-30MKI fighter jets, despite upcoming upgrades.
Fifth- and sixth-generation fighter jets are designed to operate as “spies and snipers,” equipped with the latest technology to outperform adversaries.
While previous-generation jets can supplement these advanced aircraft, frontline fighters must incorporate cutting-edge stealth, sensors, and weaponry.
Europe’s decision to bypass the fifth generation and move directly to sixth-generation programs, such as the Future Combat Air System (FCAS) and Global Combat Air Programme (GCAP), reflects the need to catch up with the U.S. in this domain.
By leveraging domestic talent, collaborating with agencies like ISRO, and securing the necessary funding and technology, India can ensure its place in the next generation of air superiority.

title: RNC Chair Michael Whatley :  Were in a Great Place to Flip the Senate
message:
Republicans are in a “great place to flip the Senate,” Republican National Committee (RNC) Chair Michael Whatley said during an appearance on Breitbart News Daily, giving the lay of the land on down-ballot races across the country.
“Right now, we’re in a great place to flip the Senate.
If Republicans win those two seats, they flip the Senate, he explained.
WATCH — GOP Senate Candidate Tim Sheehy on How to Beat Jon Tester in Montana:M. Perdie, J. Knudsen / Breitbart News“We win those two, we’re going to win the Senate.
“We’re going to deliver four new seats this Congress, but you’ve got a lot of great candidates in Pennsylvania and in Michigan and Colorado,” he said, highlighting a few specific candidates on the Senate side.

title: US Mercenary Commander Says Ukrainian Army Lacks Discipline
message:
https://sputnikglobe.com/20240822/us-mercenary-commander-points-to-lack-of-discipline-among-ukrainian-army-1119869564.htmlUS Mercenary Commander Points to Lack of Discipline Among Ukrainian ArmyUS Mercenary Commander Points to Lack of Discipline Among Ukrainian ArmySputnik InternationalThe commander of a foreign mercenary group operating in Ukraine took to social media to complain about the lack of discipline among the Ukrainian army.
According to the group's official website, the Chosen Company was raised and organized in collaboration with the Ukrainian armed forces.
O'Leary’s team came under heavy scrutiny after a story from The New York Times in July alleged that members of the Chosen Company executed Russian soldiers who had already surrendered.
Nevertheless, the commander of the foreign mercenary group went on to detail his frustrations over what he witnessed among the Ukrainian soldiers in a series of subsequent posts on X.
Two members of the Chosen Company, Lance Lawrence and Andrew Webber, were apparently killed during this operation in 2023.

title: PM Modi Pays Homage At Three Memorials , Including  Good Maharaja Square , In Warsaw
message:
Jam Saheb is fondly remembered in Poland as Dobry Maharaja,” Modi posted on X along with some photos.
During World War II, the Jamsaheb provided shelter to over a thousand Polish children and is today remembered as the Dobry(Good) Maharaja in Poland.
The memorial monument – a small brick pillar with inscriptions – was unveiled in October 2014 at the Square of the Good Maharaja, Ochota district in Warsaw.
The surviving Polish children have formed an Association of Poles, which meets annually in one of the major Polish cities, it said.
Prime Minister Modi also paid solemn homage at the Monument to the Battle of Monte Cassino in Warsaw.

title: Ukraine attacks Moscow in one of largest ever drone strikes on Russian capital
message:
Ukraine attacked Moscow on Wednesday with at least 11 drones that were shot down by air defenses in what Russian officials called one of the biggest drone strikes on the capital since the war in Ukraine began in February 2022.
The war — largely a grinding artillery and drone battle across the fields, forests and villages of eastern Ukraine — escalated on Aug. 6 when Ukraine sent thousands of soldiers over the border into Russia's western Kursk region.
For months, Ukraine has also fought an increasingly damaging drone war against the refineries and airfields of Russia, the world's second largest oil exporter, though major drone attacks on the Moscow region — with a population of over 21 million — have been rarer.

title: Tim Walz slammed by GOP veterans in letter over his  misrepresentation of service
message:
Read our privacy policy Thanks for signing up to theInside Washington email {{ #verifyErrors }} {{ message }} {{ /verifyErrors }} {{ ^verifyErrors }} Something went wrong.
Please try again later {{ /verifyErrors }}A group of 50 Republican veterans have written a letter to Tim Walzaccusing him of “egregious misrepresentations” when discussing his military service.
“Military service is not merely a job or a uniform.”It continued: “Those who serve in the Armed Forces endure rigorous training, face perilous situations, and make sacrifices that most civilians can’t comprehend.
But there is no honor in lying about the nature of your service,” the letter stated.
Attacks on Walz’s military service have been spearheaded by Republican rival JD Vance, a Marine Corps veteran ( REUTERS )“You have violated the trust of our brothers and sisters in arms.

title: Honor Flight brings World War I soldier home for burial after decades - long mystery
message:
He died in battle in France during World War I and was listed as Missing In Action (MIA).
It’s believed that McAllister died during the Army’s first large-scale offensive operation of the First World War on July 19, 1918.
“PFC Charles McAllister and the soldiers who answer the call to service in World War I were there when the world needed us.
“PFC McAllister was a patriot posthumously entitled to the following awards and decorations, the Silver Star, Purple Heart, World War I Victory medal,” said Chaplain Keith.
The SeaTac Fire Department and police, honor guards, and The American Legion of Idaho and Washington were there to honor McAllister.

title: Middle East on the brink ! Gaza ceasefire deal teeters on the edge of collapse with US official warning  all out confrontation  could follow
message:
The ceasefire deal to bring an end to the fighting in Gaza is teetering on the edge of collapse, with a US official warning that an 'full blown confrontation' could follow.
In Gaza itself, the Israeli military said jets hit around 30 targets throughout the enclave including tunnels, launch sites and an observation post.
The Israeli military struck a school and a nearby house in Gaza City, killing at least four people and wounding 15, including several children, Gaza's Civil Emergency Service said.
The Israeli military said in a statement that it hit Hamas militants operating at a command centre inside a compound that previously served as a school.
The Hamas-run Palestinian health authority said that 40,000 people were killed by the fighting in Gaza since October.

title: China - Thailand joint military exercises have  all elements needed for a small - scale war
message:
CCTV said the exercises, which run until August 29, would cover elements such as cross-border support, force deployment, joint air defence, deterrence and debriefing.
China has revealed details of its joint military exercises with Thailand, which involve the use of special forces for the first time and have been described as containing “all the elements needed for a small-scale war”.
“This is no longer a drill only with air force tactics, but a joint force combat exercise,” he said.
The exercise is taking place at the Udorn Royal Thai Air Force Base, which was formerly used by the US Air Force.
This year it has also staged joint exercises with Cambodia and Laos and agreed to boost security cooperation with Vietnam during this week’s visit by the country’s new leader To Lam.

title: Putin slow response to the Kursk attack could test the patience of some of his backers in Russia
message:
Russia was caught unprepared by the offensive and reportedly is drafting conscripts to repel some of Ukraine’s most battle-hardened units.
Putin has a history of responding slowly to various crises in his tenure, and he has so far played down the attack.
Putin is dependent on their acquiescence, said Ekaterina Schulmann, a nonresident scholar at the Carnegie Russia Eurasia Center in Berlin.
Despite promising that conscripts wouldn’t be sent to the front, Russia is deploying them to the Kursk region with not enough training, according to a human rights group that helps draftees.
As Ukraine presses its offensive, it could become difficult for the Kremlin to ignore the many consequences of the war.

title: Dune : Awakening gets 25+ minute gameplay preview
message:
Publisher and developer Funcom has shared a new block of gameplay for Dune: Awakening, their ambitious new open world MMORPG set in the Dune universe.
Set on the most dangerous planet in the universe Dune: Awakening will challenge players to…SURVIVE the scorching desert and colossal sandworms by learning the ways of the Fremen.
Additionally, journalists and creators will get a chance to try a demo of Dune: Awakening behind closed doors, and share their impressions with the wider public.
Sam Rappaport, Vice President of Interactive Media at Legendary Entertainment said, “We are incredibly excited for gamers to get their first glimpse of ‘Dune: Awakening’ at gamescom.
This game is a testament to the dedication of the developers and a thrilling new way for fans to engage with the iconic saga.”New Dune: Awakening DirectWith the Exclusive Gameplay Reveal unleashed, Funcom is thrilled to announce that the third Dune: Awakening Direct will air on August 29, showcasing even more gameplay footage and feature details, with the fantastic Soe Gschwind returning to host

title: Stunning Sci - Fi RPG  Beyond Galaxyland  Blasts Off On Switch Next Month
message:
Inspired by sci-fi movies of the 1980s and classic RPGs, Beyond Galaxyland is bound to tick a lot of boxes for a lot of people.
Beyond Galaxyland looks to split your time between the expected turn-based battles, platforming, puzzle solving and a monster-catching mechanic that will undoubtedly leave us wanting to catch 'em all.
● Active turn-based combat: Engage in strategic turn-based battles against a vast range of galactic nemeses, with time-responsive defensive gameplay to minimise damage.
● A classic sci-fi adventure: A semi-open 2.5D adventure-RPG in a classic sci-fi fish-out-of-water tale that pays homage to family-friendly adventure and sci-fi movies.
You'll be able to pick up Beyond Galaxyland on the Switch eShop next month for £14.99 / €17.99 / $17.99.

title: The Champions
message:
The ChampionsITV4 9:10 AM to 10:20 AM Thursday 22 August Share Add toCalendar +The Final Countdown Season 1 Episode 28 of 30 S SubtitlesThe trio race against time to find a Second World War bomb in a bid to stop it falling into the hands of a neo-Nazi group keen to launch another battle.

title: North Korean soldier defects to the South , reports say
message:
North Korean soldier defects to the South, reports sayA North Korean soldier crossed the heavily guarded southeastern border early Tuesday and was taken into custody by South Korean authorities, reports said.
The soldier crossed the military demarcation line within the Demilitarized Zone and expressed an intent to defect to South Korea.
The South Korean military tracked and monitored the soldier from the moment the person crossed the demarcation line.
The South Korean military is currently evaluating the effectiveness of loudspeaker propagation on the North, which resumed after North's continued trash balloon dropping last month.
Two American Army officers were axed to death in 1976 by North Korean soldiers, for instance.

title: GOP vets in Congress attack VP nominee Walz over his military record
message:
But Walz supporters countered that the GOP lawmakers are mischaracterizing both the Minnesota governor’s 24 years of honorable service and their own time in the ranks.
Officials from the group also noted that at least 20 of the GOP signers listed themselves as “retired” from the military, even though they did not serve the mandatory 20 years required for official military retirement.
Walz has said he finalized his retirement in May 2005, three months after announcing his intention to run for Congress.
Leo covers Congress, Veterans Affairs and the White House for Military Times.
He has covered Washington, D.C. since 2004, focusing on military personnel and veterans policies.

title: Diablo IV Vessel of Hatred Adds Mercenaries and The Dark Citadel
message:
The brand-new Spiritborn class received a deep-dive livestream about a month ago, during which the Diablo IV developers explored what makes it so unique.
In addition to the Spiritborn class being added to Diablo IV, players will now experience the Mercenaries feature.
One of the other new features added in this expansion for Diablo IV is The Dark Citadel.
Diablo IV Vessel of Hatred is receiving a ton of new content aside from just those two features, such as major progression updates and a new time-attack dungeon.
Products mentioned in this post Diablo IV USD 34.88

title: Magicmyna Unveils MuniTrix 4 Mortar Shell Drop System – Indian Defence Research Wing
message:
Magicmyna Unveils MuniTrix 4 Mortar Shell Drop System| BySOURCE: AFIMagicmyna, a Bengaluru-based startup, has made significant strides in drone technology with the launch of its MuniTrix 4 Mortar Shell Drop System.
MuniTrix 4 is a UAV-based solution capable of delivering payloads carrying up to four 60mm or two 81/82mm mortar ammunition.
The system boasts an advanced algorithm that accurately determines the impact area of the mortar shells.
Moreover, it offers flexibility in choosing the type of warhead, including impact detonation (IMP), delayed detonation (DLY), near-surface detonation (NSB), and distance detonation (PRX).
To ensure operational reliability, the MuniTrix 4 incorporates a jammer jamming system to counter electronic warfare threats.

title: The Voyage Home Is A Fierce And Chilling End To Pat Barker Women Of Troy Trilogy
message:
My own book, – a new history of Homer's world, told through the real women written out of it – is published next spring.
And now the final novel in Pat Barker's Trojan War series, The Voyage Home , is here.
Barker's angle (both in The Silence of the Girls and its 2021 sequel, The Women of Troy , 2021) is to insist, unrelentingly, on the grim, real hideousness of war.
GARY DOAK/Alamy Stock PhotoCassandra is loaded up on a boat out of Troy, as the Trojan women are carted back to Greece, moving towards her prophesied fate.
The Trojan War, and the traumas its women endured, will not be forgotten.

title: India advocates permanent peace , believes in dialogue , diplomacy : PM Modi in Poland ahead of Ukraine visit
message:
Whenever there is a crisis in any country in the world, India is the first country which extends a helping hand.
Wherever there is an earthquake or any disaster in the world, India has only one mantra: Humanity first.
Under this programme, India will invite 20 Polish youths annually to visit India.
In a post on X, PM Modi stated, "Earlier today, paid homage at the Monument to the Battle of Monte Cassino.
Taking to X, PM Modi stated, "Earlier today, paid homage at the Monument to the Battle of Monte Cassino.

title: Jake Tapper Rages at GOP Service Members Who Decry Walz Stolen Valor
message:
Ahead of Night Three of the Democratic National Convention were valor thief Governor Tim Walz (MN) was set the accept the veep nomination, Tapper lashed out Republicans who called out his candidate.
The U.S. Navy demoted Congressman Jackson to the rank of captain in 2022 after a scathing watchdog report.
CNN's @JakeTapper lashes out at Republicans who served in the military for calling out Tim Walz's stolen valor.
Tapper, who never served, is at the center of $1B defamation suit against CNN because of comments he made against a Navy vet who was rescuing women from Afghanistan.
The judge recently said he didn’t trust what Tapper had to say to avoid being deposed.

title: Lack of Oversight in Police Training Seminars Raises Alarms
message:
Oregon law enforcement officers will be able to receive state training credit for attending.
The events also raise questions about the relative lack of oversight of the trainings law enforcement officers must attend each year, which are overseen by the Department of Public Safety Standards and Training (DPSST).
That’s because it is up to individual law enforcement agencies to approve training credits, which they then report to DPSST.
But Rodriguez and the bureau’s Training Division are responsible only for reviewing in-house PPB training—not external trainings that PPB officers can sign up for.
When PPB officers want to sign up for an external training for DPSST credit, they must only get an application approved by their Responsibility Unit manager.

title: As Democrats rediscover their joy , Donald Trump chooses anger again in North Carolina
message:
But with Vice President Kamala Harris taking his place at the top of the ticket, the energy is different.
It’s a marked contrast from Donald Trump and Republicans, whose divisiveness and fearmongering was on full display Wednesday in North Carolina at an appearance in Asheboro.
The former president warned that a Harris victory in November could lead to destruction, ruin, danger and even World War III.
For example:“The world is on fire and Kamala and Biden have marched us to the brink of World War III.”“We’re in grave danger of a war, a third world war … Bad things are gonna start to happen, they’re already starting.”“If Comrade Kamala wins this November, World War III is virtually guaranteed to happen.
“I’ve been looking for a name, you know my names, they’ve all worked, they’ve all been very successful,” Trump said.

title: By Ignoring the Bidenite Advice , Israel Managed to Eliminate Many Hamas Jihadis
message:
One of the messages the officials are expected to deliver is that there is little more Israel can accomplish against Hamas.
In its latest statement on the airstrike, the IDF has now identified by name 38 Hamas terrorists killed at the command-and-control center functioning inside the Al Tabin school.
And dozens of other high-ranking Hamas combatants have also been killed, as the IDF continues its relentless campaign of targeted assassinations.
Now the Bidenites are urging Israel to end its war in Gaza because, they claim, there is not much more of Hamas to destroy, and the IDF needs to avoid further civilian casualties.
As for civilian casualties, in the last three months Hamas has continued to claim roughly 38,000-39,000 casualties, as usual without distinguishing between civilians and Hamas operatives.

title: Happy Birthday Joe Strummer ! | 96 . 1 The Rocket
message:
Today is Joe Strummer's birthday!
The late co-founder, of The Clash, put the band together in 1976, in the wake of the rise of punk in the U.S., following bands like The Ramones.
The Clash would make an impact with their second album, "Give 'Em Enough Rope" in 1978, when it reached No.
Unlike many of their peers in the England and even in the States, The Clash attained a critical acclaim for their raw combination of political strife and youthful angst in their music.
They would hit big in the US, with their iconic London Calling in 1979, despite the backlash that punk would receive following the failed tour of The Sex Pistols.

The late co-founder, of The Clash, put the band together in 1976, in the wake of the rise of punk in the U.S., following bands like The Ramones.
The Clash would make an impact with their second album, "Give 'Em Enough Rope" in 1978, when it reached No.
Unlike many of their peers in the England and even in the States, The Clash attained a critical acclaim for their raw combination of political strife and youthful angst in their music.
They would hit big in the US, with their iconic London Calling in 1979, despite the backlash that punk would receive following the failed tour of The Sex Pistols.

title: How to watch the Democratic National Convention from home
message:
Minnesota Governor and Democratic vice presidential nominee Tim Walz takes part in stage testing on the third day of the Democratic National Convention in Chicago, Illinois.
(Chip Somodevilla | Getty Images)The NPR Network will be reporting live from Chicago throughout the week bringing you the latest on the Democratic National Convention.
The Democratic National Convention is in Chicago, Monday, Aug. 19, through Thursday, Aug. 22.
But there is a guy named Robert Kennedy running for president and the [Democratic National Convention] is in Chicago.
Tim Walz as her running mateThe NPR Network will be reporting live from Chicago throughout the week bringing you the latest on the Democratic National Convention.

title: Biden presses Netanyahu on need to reach Gaza truce deal
message:
These include an end to Israel’s Gaza operation, a full Israeli pullout and a deal to exchange Israeli hostages for Palestinian prisoners held by Israel.
In Gaza itself, the Israeli military said jets hit around 30 targets throughout the enclave including tunnels, launch sites and an observation post.
The Israeli military struck a school and a nearby house in Gaza City, killing at least four people and wounding 15, including several children, Gaza’s Civil Emergency Service said.
The Israeli military said in a statement that it hit Hamas militants operating at a command centre inside a compound that previously served as a school.
Israel’s military campaign has killed more than 40,000 people in Gaza since October, according to Palestinian health authorities.
